result.execSummary:
The defendant Tire M Milton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Milton, Tire M

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:  THE COURT ORDERED THE Defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction (HOC), to run concurrent at to each count with credit for 0 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work, and child care.

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed Defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 MONTHS to run concurrent as to each count with the following conditions:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  Cooperate with agent.
*  Court waives all costs and surcharges. Defendant indigent.
*  Maintain full time / part time work and or schooling.
*  Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.
*  Participate in any anger management courses and cooperate fully.
*  Restitution set at ZERO.
*  No contact with Mr. G. S. or Falcon Fuel located at 1530 West State Street, in the City of Milwaukee, Milwaukee County, Wisconsin.
*  Provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.

The Court WILL NOT consider expungement due to the age of the case, and the Defendant was out on a Bench Warrant for quite some time.

Received and filed with the court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form

Defendant Tire M Milton in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Kelly Hedge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1 AND 2:    Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

AS TO COUNT 3:  On motion of the State the Court ordered Count 3 DISMISSED AND READ-IN.

Defendant Tire M Milton in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Michael Damon Phillips appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/Sentencing Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2017 at 01:30 pm.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.

Defendant Tire M Milton in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Michael Damon Phillips appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/Sentencing Hearing scheduled for September 25, 2017 at 01:30 pm.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant qualifies for public defender representation.

Defendant Tire M Milton in court.  Alicia H. Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 5, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Defendant to appear at all future court appearances.

Defendant Tire M Milton in court.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY BE Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Tire M Milton not in court.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 2/4/15 @ 1 PM
